_header: An old sad saw unknown uncast
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 150.
Subjects: advice, moral; carols, of moral counsel
_description: Cast not away thine Old for New — four 5-line stanzas (aaabb) including refrain, ‘…elles most we drynk as we brew’, and burden (aa): ‘An old sawe hath be fownd trewe…’

OxfBal354.First Lines:
An old said sawe On knowen on kysteWher is lytill love þer is
                    lytill tryste…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…& if þou do so thow shalt not rewe& ellis must
                    þou drynk as þou doste breweExplicit
OxfBal354.Facsimiles:
Early Manuscripts at Oxford University: Facsimile
                    of Oxford, Balliol MS 354.
         (http://image.ox.ac.uk/show?collection=balliol&manuscript=ms354).
OxfBal354.Editions:
Flügel,  Ewald. 
             “Liedersammlungen des XVI Jahrhunderts….” 
             Anglia
         26 (1903): 94-285: 266-7.
Dyboski,  R.,
                        ed.  
             Songs, Carols and Other Miscellaneous Poems from Balliol MS. 354,
                Richard Hill’s Commonplace Book.
EETS
          e.s. 101 (1908); repr. 1984: 47.
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 235; 1977, 209.

TCD212.First Lines:
an wollde seyd saw had byn funde ful trucaste not awey þy
                    wollde for þy new…
TCD212.Last Lines:
…the tyme woll cum þat þe muste be releuydgeue
                    truste to hym þat þu haste yprevyd
TCD212.Note:
Variant version; three couplets, written one couplet per line of
                    MS.
TCD212.Editions:
Scattergood,  V. John. 
             “Proverbial Verses in Trinity College, Dublin MS 212.” 
             Notes and Queries
         n.s. 30 [228] (1983): 489-90: 4899.
